alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued March 27 at 3:56AM PDT until March 27 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 2 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 32 will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, south winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Santa Clara Hills and East Bay Hills. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, until 9 AM PDT Monday. For the Wind Advisory, from 5 AM to 2 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and power outages may result. Residents in homes without power as well as the unsheltered or marginally sheltered populations will be at risk in these cold early morning temperatures. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds are expected for the higher elevations of the East Bay Hills and Eastern Santa Clara Hills. Localized areas of higher terrain could see gusts greater than 55 mph.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills
